column4: I need to unrar all the files in a folder.  I tried "find -type f -name '*.rar' -exec unrar x {} \;" but they are all failing to unrar.  Any ideas?
It says "failed to unrar" but it tries to unrar each part individually, so I think it was just that it was trying to unrar each file individually.
well your glob is not specific enough I suppose, you want only the first part, no?
and you unrar multi-part rars by unrarring the first part, don't you?
so again, your glob is not specific enough.  glob only the first part
mbn_18, nevermind, I figured it out (I forgot I passworded them).  Thanks for the help.
kpettit: -d is only to upgrade to development releases

Thanks, but I don't need an upgrade, I have /home separate, so I can format / without an issue.  I am just asking how I can initiate the "upgrade" from my existing install.  It's an eeepc so no CD-Rom.
can't you just install 10.10 the same way you installed 9.10?
I'm trying, but unetbootin didn't have an option for 10.10, I had to manually add an 10.10 iso.  It doesn't seem to boot normally.
I see.  Did you try usb disk creator?
